recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30-45 minutes, or until beef is tender.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add fish and cook until lightly browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until fish is cooked through.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add chickpeas and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until chickpeas are tender.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add potatoes and cauliflower and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large bowl, mix together flour and salt. Add water and stir to form a dough.
2. Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
3. Divide dough into 8-10 equal parts. Roll each part into a ball.
4. Using a rolling pin, roll each ball into a circle, about 6 inches in diameter.
5. Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Cook each chapati for 1-2 minutes on each side, until lightly browned and cooked through.
6. Serve warm with your favorite curry.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add fish and cook until lightly browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until fish is cooked through.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large bowl, mix together rice flour, grated coconut, sugar, and salt. Add water and stir to form a dough.
2. Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
3. Divide dough into 16-18 equal parts. Roll each part into a ball.
4. Flatten each ball into a circle, about 2-3 inches in diameter.
5. Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Cook eachpitha for 1-2 minutes on each side, until lightly browned and cooked through.
6. Serve warm with tea or coffee.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add beef and cook until lightly browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
3. Add tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until beef is cooked through.
5. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for another minute.
2. Add cauliflower, potatoes, peas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked through.
4. Serve with fresh cilantro and rice.

1. In a small bowl, mix together cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, salt, and black pepper.
2. Rub spice mixture over both sides of fish fillets.
3. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add fish fillets and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
4. Serve with lemon wedges and green salad.

1. In a large bowl, mix together flour and salt. Add oil and mix until well combined.
2. Gradually add water and knead until dough forms. Cover with a damp cloth and let rest for 30 minutes.
3. Divide dough into 8 equal parts. Roll each part into a thin circle.
4. In a large skillet, heat over medium-high heat. Add chapati and cook for 30-45 seconds on each side, or until lightly browned.
5. Serve warm with curry or chutney.

recipes.name: Spicy Shrimp Curry
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. 3. Add chili powder, turmeric, and coriander and stir for 1 minute. 4. Add shrimp and cook for 3-4 minutes until pink. 5. Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens. 6. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Masoor Daal
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Rinse the lentils in cold water and drain. 2. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. 3. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. 4. Add cumin and coriander and stir for 1 minute. 5. Add the lentils and stir for 1-2 minutes until coated in the spices. 6. Add water and tomato and bring to a boil. 7. Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until the lentils are tender. 8. Serve hot with rice or bread.
